4️⃣ **Harness your Social Media** 4️⃣ 

"Module 4 - Harness your LinkedIn" <:LinkedIn:1151528768406556732>

**Summary:**
- Business-oriented social platform for networking
- You can set up a profile with lots of relevant information about your skills
- People can add endorsements to your profile to show that you know what you’re doing

**Action steps:**
- Create a LinkedIn account
- Ask colleagues, co-workers, and friends to add endorsements to your profile

What do you do after you created your profile?

A Write blog posts.
B Dm "important" and "unimportant" people to network.
C Write blog posts and join LinkedIn Groups. -

•




"LinkedIn For Lead Generation"

**Summary:**
- The company page helps leads learn about your company, but you don’t need it yet
- LinkedIn is built for professionals so it’s a great lead-generation platform
- Groups are a great place to engage with your community and establish yourself as a thought leader

**Action steps:**
- Join groups and engage with people in your industry

Is LinkedIn a good lead-gen platform?

A Yes -
B No, not really

•




"Simple Steps For LinkedIn"

**Summary:**
- Get followers - don’t post into the air, engage with other people
- Share relevant content that you know your audience wants to see
- Set up a content calendar to stay consistent
- Use tracking and analytics to understand more about your audience
- Experiment with videos and photos
- Target your audience and make your content for them

**Action steps:**
- Engage with people in your industry
- Understand your audience
- Post behind-the-scenes videos

How many of the "Simple Steps" were mentioned in the video?
A 6 -
b 5
c 4
d 3

•


2️⃣** Part 2** 2️⃣ 

"Common Mistakes When Using LinkedIn"

**Summary:**
- You can upgrade to premium for extra features but you don’t need it until later
- You can display your work on your LinkedIn portfolio

**Common mistakes:**
- Writing your summary in 3rd person
- Having a bad photo (or none at all)
- Sending generic invitations
- Not being consistent

**Action steps:**
- Add your previous work to your portfolio
- Make sure you aren’t doing any of the common mistakes

Are you going to listen to the video and avoid the 4 common mistakes?

A Yes, of course Miguel

•




"How To Build Influence On LinkedIn"

**Summary:**
- Engaging with people daily and staying consistent will build up your influence
- You can focus on becoming a thought leader later
- Be consistent. Be original. Share and promote your older posts.
- Creator mode allows you to share posts on certain topics

**Action steps:**
- Do not copy a DM template

Did you watch the video?

A Ofcourse

"Tips For An Effective Profile"

**Summary:**
- Keep your profile up-to-date
- Add relevant skills
- Ask for recommendations
- For prospecting, don’t use the main search bar. Filter by particular fields to get useful results

**Action steps:**
- Develop the abundance mindset

Did you watch the video?

A Ofcourse

"How to Set Up Your Linkedin Profile and Find Clients"

**Summary:**
- put effort into crafting a great profile because it matters for clients and employers
- apply as a freelancer for remote work

**Action Steps:**
- set up your profile
- apply for jobs

What is a job mentioned in the video?

A Copywriter -
B Pimping
C CFO
D Consultant

💡Here are the steps on how to search for jobs on LinkedIn specifically:

> 1. Go to the LinkedIn homepage and click on the "Jobs" icon.
> 
> 2. In the search bar, type in the keywords for the job you are looking for. For example, if you are looking for a job as a software engineer, you might type in "software engineer" or "software development."
> 
> 3. You can also use filters to narrow down your search results. For example, you can filter by location, job title, company, or industry.
> 
> 4. Once you have found some jobs that you are interested in, click on the "View Job" button to learn more about the position.
> 
> 5. If you are interested in applying for a job, click on the "Apply" button. 

PS: You can apply for a job directly on LinkedIn or you can download the LinkedIn app and apply from there.

💡Here are some additional tips for searching for jobs on LinkedIn:

> Use keywords that are relevant to the job you are looking for. The more specific your keywords are, the more likely you are to find relevant job openings.
> 
> Use filters to narrow down your search results. This will help you save time and focus on the jobs that are most relevant to you.
> 
> Read the job descriptions carefully before applying for a job. Make sure that you have the skills and experience that the employer is looking for.
> 
> Tailor your resume and cover letter to each job you apply for. This will show the employer that you are interested in the position and that you have the skills and experience they are looking for.
> 
> Be patient. It's all about daily EFFORT IN. Don't give up, and keep applying for jobs that you are interested in.
